title: Noel Reid
text:
Noel Reid (born 22 May 1990) is an Irish <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for <a href="SU%20Agen%20Lot-et-Garonne">Agen</a>. Between 2011 and 2019 he played 120 games for <a href="Leinster%20Rugby">Leinster</a>. His preferred position is fly-half or centre.
Early career.
In 2007, Reid won the <a href="Leinster%20Schools%20Rugby%20Senior%20Cup">Leinster Schools Rugby Senior Cup</a> with <a href="St%20Michael%27s%20College%2C%20Dublin">St Michael's College</a>.
Professional career.
Leinster.
He made his senior debut in September 2012 against the <a href="Scarlets">Scarlets</a> and scored a hattrick on his debut.
Leicester Tigers.
Ahead of the 2019–20 season, Reid will join <a href="Premiership%20Rugby">English Premiership</a> side <a href="Leicester%20Tigers">Leicester Tigers</a>. He left ahead of the 2020–21 season.
Agen.
He signed with France <a href="Top14">Top14</a> side <a href="SU%20Agen%20Lot-et-Garonne">Agen</a> ahead of the 2020–21 season.
Ireland.
Reid made his senior debut for <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland</a> on 14 June 2014 when coming off the bench in the second test of the tour to <a href="Argentina%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Argentina</a>.
